#summary Building the RDKit on CentOS 5.7

For older versions of CentOS, where things are more difficult, see [BuildingOnCentOS this page]

= Getting ready =

== Packages to install using yum ==
  * cmake (2.6, which comes with centos)
  * group "Development Tools"
  * tk-devel readline-devel zlib-devel bzip2-devel sqlite-devel

== Packages to install from source ==
  * python 2.7 : use `./configure CFLAGS=-fPIC --enable-unicode=ucs4 --enable-shared`
  * numpy : do `export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/lib"` before `python setup.py install`
  * flex 
  * boost 1.48.0 : do `./bootstrap.sh --with-libraries=python,regex; ./b2; ./b2 install`
  

= Building the RDKit =

{{{
[glandrum@localhost ~]$ cd RDKit/
[glandrum@localhost RDKit]$ export RDBASE=`pwd`
[glandrum@localhost RDKit]$ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$RDBASE/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH"
[glandrum@localhost RDKit]$ export PYTHONPATH="$RDBASE:$PYTHONPATH"
[glandrum@localhost RDKit]$ mkdir build
[glandrum@localhost RDKit]$ cd build
[glandrum@localhost build]$ cmake -D BOOST_ROOT=/usr/local -D PYTHON_LIBRARY=/usr/local/lib/python2.7/config/libpython2.7.a -D PYTHON_INCLUDE_PATH=/usr/local/include/python2.7/ -D PYTHON_EXECUTABLE=/usr/local/bin/python2.7 ..
[glandrum@localhost build]$ make -j2 install
[glandrum@localhost build]$ ctest
}}}
